course.subject: HD
course.course_title: The Black Family and the Socialization of Black Children

notes.note: This course can be used to fulfill the social science requirement for HD majors and college credit requirements for other majors in Human Ecology. Enrollment limited to freshmen.
Prerequisite: HD 1150 or PSYCH 1101.
Prerequisites: HD 1150, 1170, or Psych 1101.
Recommended: introductory psychology or human development.
Prerequisites: Psych 1101 or HD 1150.
Course is for Human Development majors ONLY.
Prerequisites: HD 1150 or HD 1170 or PSYCH 1101 or HD 2330 or PSYCH 2650.
Prerequisites: Psych 3250 or HD 3700 (or taken concurrently), and permission of instructor. Students must commit to taking Psych 3280 in spring semester.

course.subject: HD
course.course_title: Participation with Children, Families, and Their Communities

notes.note: Prerequisite: HD 1150 and two of the following, HD 2300, HD 3460, HD 4490, HD 4520 or EDUC 2400. Enrollment limited to: seniors or juniors.
Prerequisites: HD 1150, a biology course, a statistics course. Not open to freshmen.
Prerequisities: HD 1150 or HD 1170 or PSYCH 1101 and HD 2600/PSYCH 2750 or HD 2610 or PSYCH 2800.
Required prerequisites: HD 1150 OR HD 1170. Recommended Prerequisites: PSYCH 1101.

course.subject: HD
course.course_title: Risk and Opportunity Factors in Childhood and Adolescence

notes.note: Prerequisites: HD 1150 and 2160.

This is a laboratory course and the professor's permission is absolutely required to enroll. Students in this class will attend weekly lab meetings, read pertinent papers, write reaction responses, and work on various tasks in the professor's lab on the professor's projects for 10.75 hours per week.
Prerequisites: HD 1150 or HD 1170 or PSYCH 1101 and HD 2610 or HD 2600.

This is a laboratory course and the professor's permission is absolutely required to enroll. Students in this class will attend weekly lab meetings, read pertinent papers, write reaction responses, and work on various tasks in the professor's lab on the professor's projects for 10.75 hours per week.

course.subject: HD
course.course_title: Cognitive, Social, and Developmental Aspects of Scientific Reasoning

notes.note: Prerequisites: junior or senior standing; HD 2180 or HD 2510 or permission of instructor.

course.subject: HD
course.course_title: Psychopathology in Great Works of Literature

notes.note: Permission of instructor and limited to seniors who major in Sociology, Psychology, Human Development and Economics. Capstone seminar for seniors who are interested in graduate study in scientific disciplines that focus on human behavior. Course is designed to mirror the introductory course SOC/HD 1840 Six Pretty Good Books.
Must attend HD 3190 on W 2:00-4:25.

course.subject: HD
course.class_descr: First Yr Proseminar in Hum Dev

notes.note: Yearlong. 1 credit. Prerequisite: first-year HD graduate students
Upper level undergraduates need instructor permission to take this course.

course.subject: HD
course.course_title: Genetic, Environmental, and Epigenetic Processes in the Development of Individual Differences

notes.note: Prerequisites: HD 2220 and 3660, NBB 2210, or PSYCH 2230. Must attend HD 4660 on TR 10:10-11:25.
